          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "Variables with automatic storage duration can only be declared at block scope (directly within a function or within a block in that function). They are usable only in the period between entering and leaving the function or block. Once the variable goes out of scope (either by returning from the function or by leaving the block), its storage is automatically deallocated. Any further references to the same variable from pointers are invalid and lead to undefined behaviour."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",

        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551936688141,
          "id": "931a82ff-445a-40e7-b70b-7802515d1bd8",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551936688141,
          "parent_id": "bad6b5d7-019f-4590-980d-8f48ca1a4fc2",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "register int x; /* legal at block scope, illegal at file scope */\nauto int y; /* same */\n\nstatic int z; /* legal at both file and block scope */\nextern int a; /* same */\n\nextern int b = 5; /* legal and redundant at file scope, illegal at block scope */\n\n/* legal because typedef is treated like a storage class specifier syntactically */\nint typedef new_type_name;"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
      "98824aeb-28e0-4f66-8d0a-86c95d27baaa": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551936688142,
          "id": "98824aeb-28e0-4f66-8d0a-86c95d27baaa",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551936688142,
          "parent_id": "bad6b5d7-019f-4590-980d-8f48ca1a4fc2",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "Variables with static storage duration live throughout the whole execution of the program and can be declared both at file scope (with or without "
              ],
              ["static", [["c"]]],
              [") and at block scope (by putting "],
              ["static", [["c"]]],
              [
                " explicitly). They are usually allocated and initialized by the operating system at program startup and reclaimed when the process terminates. In practice, executable formats have dedicated sections for such variables ("
              ],
              ["data", [["c"]]],
              [", "],
              ["bss", [["c"]]],
              [" and "],
              ["rodata", [["c"]]],
              [
                ") and these whole sections from the file are mapped into memory at certain ranges."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 5
        }
      },

      "c40d1fd6-f960-4b8a-b22a-d22b09f78852": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551936688140,
          "id": "c40d1fd6-f960-4b8a-b22a-d22b09f78852",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551936688140,
          "parent_id": "bad6b5d7-019f-4590-980d-8f48ca1a4fc2",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "Keyword | Storage Duration | Linkage | Remarks |\n––––– | –––––––– | ––––– | —–– |"
              ],
              ["static", [["c"]]],
              [
                " | Static | Internal | Sets internal linkage for objects at file scope; sets static storage duration for objects at block scope. |"
              ],
              ["extern", [["c"]]],
              [
                " | Static | External | Implied and therefore redundant for objects defined at file scope which also have an initializer. When used in a declaration at file scope without an initializer, hints that the definition is to be found in another translation unit and will be resolved at link-time. |"
              ],
              ["auto", [["c"]]],
              [
                " | Automatic | Irrelevant | Implied and therefore redundant for objects declared at block scope. |"
              ],
              ["register", [["c"]]],
              [
                " | Automatic | Irrelevant | Relevant only to objects with automatic storage duration. Provides a hint that the variable should be stored in a register. An imposed constraint is that one cannot use the unary "
              ],
              ["&", [["c"]]],
              [
                " “address of” operator on such an object, and therefore the object cannot be aliased. |"
              ],
              ["typedef", [["c"]]],
              [
                " | Irrelevant | Irrelevant | Not a storage class specifier in practice, but works like one from a syntactic point of view. The only difference is that the declared identifier is a type, rather than an object. |"
              ],
              ["_Thread_local", [["c"]]],
              [
                " | Thread | Internal/external | Introduced in C11, to represent "
              ],
              ["thread storage duration", [["i"]]],
              [". If used at block scope, it shall also include "],
              ["extern", [["c"]]],
              [" or "],
              ["static", [["c"]]],
              ["."]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

          "ignore_block_count": true,

          "parent_id": "bad6b5d7-019f-4590-980d-8f48ca1a4fc2",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "The ordering of storage class specifiers with respect to top-level type specifiers ("
              ],
              ["int", [["c"]]],
              [", "],
              ["unsigned", [["c"]]],
              [", "],
              ["short", [["c"]]],
              [", etc.) and top-level type qualifiers ("],
              ["const", [["c"]]],
              [", "],
              ["volatile", [["c"]]],
              [") is not enforced, so both of these declarations are valid:"]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
      "e5caec8d-ec2c-4ce7-9a05-5aec987fdf89": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551936688144,
          "id": "e5caec8d-ec2c-4ce7-9a05-5aec987fdf89",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551936688144,
          "parent_id": "bad6b5d7-019f-4590-980d-8f48ca1a4fc2",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "Linkage is only relevant to objects (functions and variables) declared at file scope and affects their visibility across different translation units. Objects with external linkage are visible in every other translation unit (provided that the appropriate declaration is included). Objects with internal linkage are not exposed to other translation units and can only be used in the translation unit where they are defined."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
